sn11.14:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
sn11.14:4.2: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
sn11.14:5.1: “Once upon a time, mendicants, there was a poor person, impoverished and pitiful.
sn11.14:5.2: They took up faith, ethics, learning, generosity, and wisdom in the teaching and training announced by the Realized One.
sn11.14:5.3: After undertaking these things, when their body broke up, after death, they were reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm, in the company of the gods of the Thirty-Three.
sn11.14:5.4: There they outshone the other gods in beauty and glory.
sn11.14:5.5: But the gods of the Thirty-Three complained, grumbled, and objected:
sn11.14:5.7: For when this god was a human being in their past life they were poor, impoverished, and pitiful.
sn11.14:5.8: And when their body broke up, after death, they were reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm, in the company of the gods of the Thirty-Three.
sn11.14:5.9: Here they outshine the other gods in beauty and glory.’
sn11.14:6.1: Then Sakka, the Lord of Gods, addressed the gods of the Thirty-Three:
sn11.14:6.2: ‘Good sirs, don’t complain about this god.
sn11.14:6.3: When this god was a human being in their past life they took up faith, ethics, learning, generosity, and wisdom in the teaching and training announced by the Realized One.
sn11.14:6.4: After undertaking these things, when their body broke up, after death, they’ve been reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm, in the company of the gods of the Thirty-Three.
sn11.14:6.5: Here they outshine the other gods in beauty and glory.’
sn11.14:6.6: Then Sakka, the Lord of Gods, guiding the gods of the Thirty-three, recited this verse:
sn11.14:7.1: ‘Whoever has faith in the Realized One,
sn11.14:7.4: praised and loved by the noble ones;
sn11.14:8.1: who has confidence in the Saṅgha,
sn11.14:8.4: their life is not in vain.
sn11.14:9.3: should be committed to faith and ethical conduct,
